data.text:
Christian Jupp is famous as the spouse of actress Emily Lloyd-Pack who is known by many as Emily Lloyd. Christian is a former musician. He is said to be a vocalist in The Flying Medallions. According to sources, Christian was born in the year 1970 but his real date of birth is unknown. He got married to Emily Lloyd, an English actress and they gave birth to Arrabelle. Much is unavailable about the early life of Christian Jupp. Other details of his life are yet to be discovered.

Christian Jupp: Bio Summary

Personal Details

Christian Jupp is a vocalist but is famous as the husband of well-known actress Emily Lloyd. His wife had her breakthrough with the role in the 1987 film Wish You Were Here, which has won Best Actress awards from the National Society of Film Critics and the Evening Standard British Film Awards. His wifeâs celebrity status has made him popular as well. Christian Jupp and his wife Emily Lloyd dated each other for a while before getting married in October 2014. They have a beautiful daughter called Arrabelle.

Previously, Christianâs wife had a long-term relationship with Danny Huston and they started dating in 1993. They separated in late 1994. Christianâs wife disclosed that she was sexually abused by a family friend when she was five years old, which was a major cause of her anxiety and depression.

About Christian Juppâs Famous Wife

Christian Jupp is married to English actress Emily Lloyd. His wife was born Emily Lloyd-Pack on 29 September 1970 in London. Christianâs wife is the daughter of Sheila Hughes, a theatrical agent who was a long-time secretary at Harold Pinterâs stage agency, and actor Roger Lloyd-Pack. She had a grandfather who was a stage and film actor, called Charles Lloyd-Pack.

Christianâs wife, Emily was just 16 years when she starred in her debut film, the 1987 Wish You Were Here. She has received critical acclaim for her role in the film. The film was based loosely on the memoirs of Cynthia Payne. She has also received multiple film offers and reportedly beat over 5,000 actresses, including Jodie Foster, for the lead role in the 1989 film Cookie.

She played a role in the 1989 film In Country opposite Bruce Willis and the 1990 film Chicago Joe and the Showgirl. She was cast in Woody Allenâs 1992 film Husbands and Wives and played a supporting role in Robert Redfordâs A River Runs Through It. She has starred in several other films as well and made her dÃ©but on the stage in 1996 as Bella Kooling in Max Klapper at the Electric Cinema.

Also Read: Filomena Aveiro: Jose Dinis Aveiroâs Mother

Christianâs wife, Emily was suffering from mental health. She started suffering in her late teens. She has also missed out on numerous prominent roles due to a combination of factors. Actress Emily Lloyd declined the lead role in the 1990 film Pretty Woman as she had agreed to star in Mermaids, from which she was later recast.

Her deteriorating health affected her ability to work in the 1992 film Husbands and Wives and she got herself fired. She was replaced in the film Tank Girl ( 1995 ). In 1997, a journalist said Lloyd was âin danger of becoming better known for the parts she has lost than those she has playedâ. Though she continued to act in films during this time, she was mostly relegated to supporting roles.

Christianâs wife was still battling with her mental health and it got worse in later years. She had difficulty finding work and was diagnosed with several mental health conditions. Her health became stabilized by the year 2013. She published an autobiography, Wish I Was There that same year.
